ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Great course to review and deepen knowledge of the Italian language. There is not a single unkind or unhelpful prof in the Italian department. Deborah was amazing and I loved the class
Furthered my Italian knowledge. Worked on conversational skills, and expanded grammatical knowledge.
I became much more proficient in speaking and understanding Italian.
This course definitely improved my ability to think in foreign languages, as well as memorization and application of new vocabulary.
Better understanding of Italian
This course provided a comprehensive review of the previous levels material as well as new information that was interesting, culturally relevant, and productive for the retainment of the language.
I furthered my learning of the Italian language

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: taught very well, instructor was very helpful/engaging, workload was fairly balanced

Strengths: good structure. Very conversational. 

Weaknesses: perhaps more feedback necessary on weekly essays. A mid-semester check in about common errors would be helpful.
I loved the synchronous day. Sometimes there was a lot of work expected in a 24-hour turnaround.

This course was very strong in how it forced students to stay constantly working in the language and practicing new skills. I thought that the choice to have Friday classes be asynchronous made the workload more balanced than 5 days per week.
This course was very well-organized and conducive to learning and retainment. The activities and open conversations were casual but helpful for becoming a better speaker.
Class discussion was interesting and enjoyable

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, as a language requirement but also to really learn the language.
Yes absolutely. Even if you are just fulfilling a language requirement, the Italian department at Yale is a great one to be involved in
Italian is one of the easier languages to fulfill the requirement without being a completely unrewarding/fake class.
Yes, this course was very engaging and enjoyable in class. Assignments every single night present a decent workload, but it is very manageable.
Yes!
I would definitely recommend this course- it was super engaging and the feedback was always helpful and clear. Students were fully prepared for the next level 4, as well.
Yes
